Context:
Dr. Eileen De Courcy joined George Brown College as Vice-President, Academic in August 2022. She leads the academic enterprise with a focus on innovative programming and academic excellence. Eileen holds a PhD in Curriculum and Pedagogy from the Ontario Institute for Studies in Education at the University of Toronto, a Master of Arts in Education Administration from Central Michigan University, a Bachelor of Education in Adult Education from Brock University, and a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Guelph. She has received recognition and awards for leading innovations in teaching and learning in higher education, most notably for leading the development of cutting-edge virtual reality content in college curriculum and for her work in reimagining learning spaces in higher education.

Eileen has extensive experience working across educational systems including secondary school, university, college and executive education. Prior to joining George Brown College, she served as Senior Vice-President, Academic at St. Lawrence College in Kingston, Ontario, and held progressive leadership roles at Humber College including Associate Vice-President, Academic Teaching and Learning and Director of Professional Development. Prior to joining the college system, she held various leadership positions at York University and the Simcoe Muskoka School Board. She spent several years teaching including serving as an adjunct professor at Brock University.
